Bash(git -C "c:\Users\×™××™×¨ ×§×“×•×©\ARON_TZIYUD" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Feature: Dynamic vehicle models database with admin UI

Major upgrade to vehicle lookup system:

1. Database Migration:
   - Created vehicle_models table in Supabase
   - Stores PCD data (bolt patterns) for all vehicle models
   - Indexed for fast lookups by make, model, year, PCD
   - Public read access, authenticated write access

2. Import System:
   - POST /api/vehicle-models/import - Import CSV data to Supabase
   - Migrates existing pcd-database.csv to cloud database
   - Batch processing for large datasets

3. Vehicle Models API:
   - GET /api/vehicle-models - Search models by make/model/year
   - POST /api/vehicle-models - Add new vehicle model manually
   - Validates required fields (make, model, bolt_count, PCD)

4. Admin UI - Add Missing Models:
   - New "â• ×”×•×¡×£ ×“×’× ×œ×××’×¨" button when vehicle not found
   - Auto-fills form with vehicle data from data.gov.il
   - Manual entry for: make, model, years, bolt specs, tire sizes
   - Saves to shared database for all stations

5. Updated Vehicle Lookup:
   - Changed from static CSV to dynamic Supabase queries
   - Same search logic: make + model + year range
   - Backwards compatible - no UI changes for users
   - Better performance with database indexing

Benefits:
âœ… Managers can add missing models without code changes
âœ… Database grows over time with real-world data
âœ… All stations share the same updated database
âœ… Easy to maintain and extend in the future

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git -C "c:\Users\×™××™×¨ ×§×“×•×©\ARON_TZIYUD" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Feature: Manager authentication for adding vehicle models

Added login requirement for adding vehicle models to database:

1. Manager Authentication:
   - New login modal when clicking "Add Model" button
   - Phone + password verification
   - Stores session in localStorage
   - Auto-redirects to add model form after successful login

2. API Endpoint:
   - POST /api/wheel-stations/auth
   - Verifies manager phone and station password
   - Returns manager details on success

3. User Flow:
   - Click "â• Add Model" â†’ Check if logged in
   - If not logged in â†’ Show login modal
   - After login â†’ Opens add model form with pre-filled data
   - If already logged in â†’ Opens form directly

4. Security:
   - Only authenticated station managers can add models
   - Saves `added_by` field with manager phone
   - Prevents spam and incorrect data

Benefits:
âœ… Better data quality - only verified managers add models
âœ… Accountability - tracks who added each model
âœ… Prevents spam and malicious entries
âœ… Maintains database integrity

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

)")

Bash(git -C "c:\Users\×™××™×¨ ×§×“×•×©\ARON_TZIYUD" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Security: Add RLS policies to wheel_station_push_subscriptions

Added Row Level Security to the push subscriptions table:
- Enable RLS on the table
- Allow public INSERT for creating subscriptions
- Allow public SELECT for reading subscriptions (needed for sending)
- Allow public UPDATE for marking inactive when unsubscribing
- Allow public DELETE for removing subscriptions

This removes the "UNRESTRICTED" warning in Supabase dashboard.
The table doesn''t contain sensitive data (just push endpoints).

Note: This migration needs to be run manually in Supabase SQL Editor.

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git -C "c:\Users\×™××™×¨ ×§×“×•×©\ARON_TZIYUD" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Security: Protect manager phone numbers in push subscriptions

Enhanced RLS policies for wheel_station_push_subscriptions:

1. Service Role (server-side):
   - Full access to read/write subscriptions
   - Used by API endpoints to send notifications
   - Can access phone numbers securely

2. Public Users (anon/authenticated):
   - Can only INSERT new subscriptions (when subscribing)
   - Can only DELETE by endpoint (when unsubscribing)
   - CANNOT read manager phone numbers

3. Why this matters:
   - The table contains manager_phone field (personal data)
   - Previous policy allowed anyone to read all phone numbers
   - New policy restricts SELECT to service role only
   - Public can only subscribe/unsubscribe, not view others

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git -C "c:\Users\×™××™×¨ ×§×“×•×©\ARON_TZIYUD" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Feature: Import vehicle data from Google Sheets instead of local CSV

Changed vehicle models import to fetch from Google Sheets:

1. Removed dependency on local file system (fs/path)
   - Works in production (Vercel) without file access

2. Accept Google Sheets URL in two ways:
   - Via request body: { sheetsUrl: "..." }
   - Via environment: VEHICLE_DATA_SHEETS_URL

3. Auto-convert Google Sheets URLs:
   - From: /spreadsheets/d/{ID}/edit#gid=0

Feature: Support both file upload AND Google Sheets for vehicle import

Enhanced vehicle models import to support two methods:

1. File Upload (multipart/form-data):
   - Upload CSV file directly
   - Works in development with local files
   - Good for one-time imports

2. Google Sheets URL (JSON body):
   - Fetch data from Google Sheets
   - Works in production (Vercel)
   - Easy to update without redeploying
   - Share with multiple admins

How it works:
- Detects content-type to determine which method
- Auto-converts Google Sheets URLs to CSV export
- Returns source information in response

Usage:
# File upload:
POST /api/vehicle-models/import
Headers: Authorization: Bearer {KEY}
Body: form-data with "file" field

# Google Sheets:
POST /api/vehicle-models/import
Headers: Authorization: Bearer {KEY}, Content-Type: application/json
Body: { "sheetsUrl": "https://docs.google.com/..." }

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Feature: Dynamic district management system

Converted static districts to fully dynamic database-driven system with admin panel:

1. Database Schema (migration 20251212_create_districts_table.sql):
   - Created districts table: id, code, name, color, timestamps
   - Hex color validation constraint
   - Foreign key from wheel_stations to districts
   - RLS policies for read/write access
   - Default 6 districts inserted (jerusalem, north, center, south, haifa, tel_aviv)

2. Districts Library (src/lib/districts.ts):
   - Changed from static object to database fetching
   - Added 5-minute caching to reduce DB calls
   - getDistricts(): Fetch all districts from DB
   - clearDistrictsCache(): Clear cache when districts change
   - Helper functions accept optional districts parameter

3. Search Page (src/app/wheels/search/page.tsx):
   - Fetch districts dynamically in parallel with wheels
   - Updated filter dropdown to use fetched districts
   - Display district name and color on station cards

4. Admin Panel (src/app/wheels/admin/page.tsx):
   - Added "ğŸ—ºï¸ × ×”×œ ××—×•×–×•×ª" toggle button
   - Districts management section with:
     âœ“ Grid display of all districts with color dots
     âœ“ Add new district (code, name, color picker)
     âœ“ Edit existing district (name, color - code immutable)
     âœ“ Delete district with confirmation dialog
   - Color picker with both visual and hex input
   - Responsive design for mobile/desktop

5. API Endpoints:
   - GET /api/districts - List all districts
   - POST /api/districts - Create new district
   - PUT /api/districts/[id] - Update district
   - DELETE /api/districts/[id] - Delete district (prevents deletion if in use)

Benefits:
âœ… Admins can add/edit/delete districts without code changes
âœ… Custom colors for each district
âœ… Cached for performance (5-min cache)
âœ… Safe deletion (checks if district is in use)
âœ… Dynamic filter dropdowns always in sync

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Correct SQL syntax in districts migration

Fixed syntax error in districts table migration:

1. Changed multi-row INSERT with ON CONFLICT to individual INSERT statements
   - PostgreSQL ON CONFLICT requires separate statements for multiple rows
   - Each district now inserted individually with its own ON CONFLICT clause

2. Removed Tel Aviv and Haifa districts per user request
   - Only 4 default districts remain: Jerusalem, North, Center, South
   - Updated migration instructions to reflect 4 districts instead of 6

3. Updated MIGRATION_INSTRUCTIONS.md
   - Added note about ensuring correct file version
   - Updated expected district count from 6 to 4

This fixes the error:
"ERROR: 42601: syntax error at or near ON CONFLICT"

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Fix: Add district field to all API endpoints for proper saving

but the API endpoints were not extracting or saving it.

   - /api/wheel-stations/admin (admin list)
   - /api/wheel-stations/[stationId] (station details)
   
2. POST endpoints - Added district handling:
   - /api/wheel-stations (super admin create)
   - /api/wheel-stations/admin (admin create)
   - Extract district from request body
   - Add to stationData interface
   - Include in insert operation

3. PUT endpoints - Added district handling:
   - /api/wheel-stations/[stationId] (super admin update)
   - /api/wheel-stations/admin/[stationId] (admin update)
   - Extract district from request body
   - Add to updateData interface
   - Support null value (allow removing district)

This fixes the issue where users saw "×”×¦×œ×™×—" (success) message but
the district was not actually saved to the database.
